0.name: Bruxism
0.description: Bruxism is the involuntary or habitual grinding of the teeth, typically during sleep. It can lead to tooth wear, jaw pain, and headaches.
0.suggested_treatment: Treatment may include the use of a night guard, stress management techniques, and dental check-ups to monitor and manage damage.

1.name: Cavities
1.description: Cavities, or dental caries, are areas of decay on the teeth caused by bacteria that produce acids. This can lead to holes and damage in the teeth.
1.suggested_treatment: Treatment typically involves dental fillings, improved oral hygiene practices, and dietary changes to reduce sugar intake.

2.name: Dental caries (tooth decay)
2.description: Dental caries is a bacterial infection that causes the decay of tooth structure. It can result in cavities and tooth sensitivity.
2.suggested_treatment: Treatment includes restorative procedures such as fillings, crowns, and root canals, along with preventive care like fluoride treatments and good oral hygiene.

3.name: Edentulism (total tooth loss)
3.description: Edentulism refers to the complete loss of all teeth in the mouth. This condition can affect speech, chewing, and appearance.
3.suggested_treatment: Options for treatment include dentures, dental implants, or fixed prosthodontics to restore function and aesthetics.

4.name: Oral cancer
4.description: Oral cancer includes cancers of the lips, tongue, cheeks, floor of the mouth, hard and soft palate, and throat. It often presents as sores or lumps that do not heal.
4.suggested_treatment: Treatment usually involves surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy depending on the stage and location of the cancer. Early detection improves prognosis.

5.name: Periodontal (gum) disease
5.description: Periodontal disease affects the gums and bone supporting the teeth, causing gum inflammation, bleeding, and potential tooth loss.
5.suggested_treatment: Treatment includes professional dental cleanings, scaling and root planing, and improved oral hygiene practices. Advanced cases may require surgery.

6.name: Thrush
6.description: Thrush is a fungal infection in the mouth caused by Candida yeast, leading to white patches on the tongue and oral mucosa.
6.suggested_treatment: Treatment involves antifungal medications, improved oral hygiene, and managing underlying conditions such as diabetes or immune system disorders.

7.name: Tooth discoloration
7.description: Tooth discoloration can be due to staining, aging, or underlying dental issues. It can affect the aesthetic appearance of the teeth.
7.suggested_treatment: Treatment options include professional teeth whitening, veneers, or dental bonding. Addressing underlying causes, such as smoking or certain medications, may also be necessary.
